sen.j: 東京行幸（とうきょうぎょうこう）とは、1868年（明治元年）と翌1869年（明治2年）の2回に亘って行われた東京への行幸である。
sen.e: Tokyo gyoko is the imperial visits to Tokyo which were made twice in 1868 and 1869.

sen.j: 明治元年7月17日、明治天皇が「江戸ヲ称シテ東京ト為スノ詔書」を発し、江戸の地で政務を執ることと、それに伴ない江戸を東京とすることを宣言した。
sen.e: On July 17, 1868, the Emperor Meiji issued 'the imperial edict that Edo is renamed Tokyo' and declared that the he would administers the affairs of state in Edo and Edo would be renamed Tokyo.
On July 17, 1868, Emperor Meiji issued 'the imperial edict to rename Edo to Tokyo' and declared that he would administer the affairs of state in Edo and Edo would be renamed Tokyo.
On September 3, 1868, Emperor Meiji issued 'the imperial edict to rename Edo to Tokyo' and declared that he would administer the affairs of state in Edo and Edo would be renamed Tokyo.

sen.j: 同年10月13日の1度目の東幸で江戸城に入城してこれを東京城と改称した。
sen.e: On October 13 of the same year during the first visit to Tokyo, the Emperor entered the Edo-jo Castle, which was renamed Tokyo-jo Castle.

On November 26 of the same year, during the first visit to Tokyo, the Emperor entered the Edo-jo Castle, which was renamed Tokyo-jo Castle.

sen.j: その後一度京都に戻り、翌年の2度目の東幸以降は東京に留まった。
sen.e: After that, the Emperor returned to Kyoto once, and on the second visit to Tokyo next year, he settled down there.
